questions.question: Context: The example of Zheng He before 1450 demonstrates that land empires like the Ming were increasingly

choices.answer: looking to create empires in the Americas.
seeking to expand trade over the Silk Road
projecting state power and encouraging overseas foreign trade.
shutting themselves off from the rest of the world.

questions.question: Which of the following environmental innovations was UNIQUE to the challenges of sailing in the Indian Ocean?

choices.answer: An understanding of seasonal monsoon wind patterns
Learning about magnetic poles & latitude to create the astrolabe & compass
Creating ways that lateen sails could move with square sails.
Applying paper technology to maritime maps

questions.question: What was NOT a reason for Unit 4 European maritime exploration and empire building?

choices.answer: Europe wanted more luxury products like spices, silk, porcelain, etc.
Europe wanted to diffuse Christianity to new territories & peoples.
European monarchs competed with rivals to gain status & wealth.
Europe wanted to rely on the Ottoman Empire for its trade.

questions.question: The BEST explanation for Europe's ability to make breakthroughs in navigation technologies would be that...

choices.answer: all navigation technologies were invented independently in Europe.
they came to them as a result of the Columbian Exchange.
Marco Polo's book had everything Europeans needed to travel Silk Roads.
technologies from other civilizations were diffused & improved upon.

questions.question: Which region DID NOT contribute navigation technologies that 15th century Europeans relied on?

choices.answer: The Americas
South Asia
East Asia
Middle East

questions.question: The empire from Unit 3 that MOST threatened European culture & economy, spurring Portugal et al to explore, was

choices.answer: the Manchu Qing
the Mughals
the Safavids
the Ottomans

questions.question: In setting "transoceanic interconnections" in motion, Portugal's primary motivation before 1450 was

choices.answer: To get African slaves to work on Brazilian sugar plantations
To get direct access to the lucrative Indian Ocean trade network
To find a mythical African Christian King named Prestor John
To establish new bases on the land-based silk routes

questions.question: How did the Unit 4 European Empires MOST differ from earlier land-based empires of Units 1, 2, & 3?

choices.answer: They were the first to transmit diseases between regions.
They were built by maritime conquest of regions oceans away
Merchants were involved for the first time in these empires.
They were the first to try to culturally convert people.

questions.question: Portugal was the 1st to create a "transoceanic interconnection" of trading posts between the

choices.answer: Atlantic Ocean and Arctic Ocean
Atlantic Ocean and Pacific Ocean
Atlantic Ocean and Indian Ocean

questions.question: The "trading posts" of European maritime empires were most similarly comparable to which Unit 2 trade network?

choices.answer: The Silk Road
Exchange in the Indian Ocean
Trans-Saharan Trade Routes
Regional trade in the Americas

questions.question: All of the following are true of Christopher Columbus' 4 voyages EXCEPT:

choices.answer: His ships were a new design known as a "caravel".
His voyages made Europeans interested in exploring beyond Afro-Eurasia.
His Spanish state-sponsored voyage created the 2nd maritime empire.
His mission to reach India succeeded so he established trading posts there.

questions.question: Increasingly, many are protesting AGAINST Columbus Day in the USA because they argue that...

choices.answer: Columbus was a great example of Italian (Latin) migration to the U.S. of A.
Columbus was a brave Christian who diffused Western Civilization.
Columbus lied, enslaved & killed natives, & his "discovery" was a theft.
C'mon, it's a day off work. What's the problem?

questions.question: Why was Spain's sponsorship of Ferdinand Magellan's voyage in 1519 historically SIGNIFICANT?

choices.answer: It was the first time a European state sponsored a transoceanic voyage.
It was the first time Europeans reached the Western Hemisphere.
It was the first circumnavigation of the entire world.
It was the first exchange of plants and animals between hemispheres.

questions.question: The first voyages of BOTH Spain and England to the Americas were motivated MOST by a

choices.answer: desire to find a new route to trade with Asia for luxury products.
need to find new fishing grounds to feed growing populations.
missionary impulse to spread either Catholic or Protestant Christianity.
competitive urge to establish settler colonies.

questions.question: Which region(s) supplied the most COTTON, SPICES, & SILK to the world market circa 1450-1750 C.E.?

choices.answer: South & Southeast Asia
West and Central Africa
The Caribbean & Mesoamerica
South America

questions.question: Which region(s) supplied the most SUGAR to feed the 'sweet tooth' of the world circa 1450-1750 C.E.?

choices.answer: South & Southeast Asia
West and Central Africa
The Caribbean & Mesoamerica
South America

questions.question: SLAVES forcibly taken to work on the plantations of the maritime empires came mostly from

choices.answer: South & Southeast Asia
West and Central Africa
The Caribbean & Mesoamerica
South America

questions.question: The Spanish discovered that they could get Asian luxury products in exchange for the SILVER they were mining in

choices.answer: South & Southeast Asia
West and Central Africa
The Caribbean & Mesoamerica
South America

questions.question: Which is an accurate definition of the Columbian Exchange?

choices.answer: The agreement between Columbus & Spain to explore a route to India.
The exchange of new plants, animals, & diseases between hemispheres.
The deal made between Portugal and Spain to divide world in half.
The tribute relations that existed between Indian Ocean trading nations.

questions.question: Which of the following WAS NOT part of the Columbian Exchange?

choices.answer: Food of the Americas was transported and grown in Eurasia
Eurasian animals were transported and raised in Americas
African religious and food culture came to the Americas
Smallpox from the Americas widely infected Europeans

questions.question: Which transfer between hemispheres would have been MOST responsible for the demographic trend you see after 1500 C.E.?

choices.answer: Sugar, bananas, & coffee from Afro-Eurasia to Americas
Horses, cattle, & pigs from Afro-Eurasia to Americas
Maize (corn), potatoes, & beans from Americas to Afro-Eurasia
Chilies, cacao, & tobacco from Americas to Afro-Eurasia

questions.question: What is the best explanation for the demographic trend you see in this chart?

choices.answer: European guns & cannons killed many Mesoamericans.
Mesoamerican chinampas were replaced with European field agriculture.
There were a large number of migrants from Iberia to Mesoamerica.
Smallpox, measles, & malaria killed 90% of Mesoamerican peoples.

questions.question: Economically, what drove rivalries between the major states of Eurasia between 1450-1750?

choices.answer: Conflict both within Christianity & between Christians with other faiths.
The challenge to authority by local elites.
Competition over trade routes & resource rich territories around the world.
Disputes about the legitimacy of dynastic rule.

questions.question: What's the best definition of "Mercantilism"?

choices.answer: An economic system of simple barter in basic commodities between merchants.
An economic system controlling merchants for the benefit of the state.
An economic system that equally distributed the profits of merchant trade.
An economic system where governments promote free trade between merchants.

questions.question: What was the ECONOMIC EFFECT of Europe's presence in Asia during this era?

choices.answer: Europe's manufactured goods became highly in demand by Asian consumers
Europe dominated Japan's markets, but was shutout of China
Europe completely dominated all Asian markets
Europe's "trading posts" prospered by using silver to trade for luxuries.

questions.question: This is the Spanish silver mine Potosi (modern Bolivia) in 1590; the workers are Native American. Which is true?

choices.answer: They were slaves forced to labor for the Spanish
They were free but were taxed by the Spanish
They used this silver to freely trade for Spanish crops
They were completely and legally equal to the Spanish

questions.question: This system of early state-sponsored Spanish colonization that relied on coerced Native labor was called

choices.answer: mit'a
chattel slavery
encomienda
indentured servitude

questions.question: What was a unique innovation of The Netherlands and England to unit 4 economics?

choices.answer: colonies in the Americas.
caravels using lateen sails.
mercantilist joint-stock companies.
silver-backed currencies.

questions.question: All of these claims could be supported by this chart EXCEPT:

choices.answer: The Netherlands formed "Joint Stock Companies" to trade.
The VOC was successful in transporting Asian luxuries to Europe.
The Dutch Joint Stock Companies were more successful than England's.
Over time, the VOC traded more within Asia than between Asia and Europe.

questions.question: All of the following are true of the British E.I.C. and the Dutch V.O.C. between 1450-1750 EXCEPT:

choices.answer: Both companies were a mixture of state & private investments.
The E.I.C. focused on cotton trade while the V.O.C. focused on spice trade.
V.O.C. "fluyts" carried more cargo making them more profitable than E.I.C.
The E.I.C. conquered the Mughals, but the V.O.C. lost Southeast Asian wars.

questions.question: How did both the Qing Dynasty & Tokugawa Shogunate respond to European influence?

choices.answer: They encouraged the spread of Christianity in their territories.
They allowed European merchants free trading privileges.
They cut off all contact with the outside world.
They promoted Asian trade but limited European missionaries & merchants.

questions.question: All of these civilizations participated in Unit 2 Trans-Saharan trade. How did their trade CHANGE in 1450-1750?

choices.answer: They traded salt and gold north and east into the Mediterranean system.
They used slaves for domestic household and agricultural tasks.
They captured slaves for Atlantic export in exchange for European goods.
They reduced their reliance on trade in favor of domestic production.

questions.question: This map of the Trans-Atlantic Slave Trade could BEST be used to demonstrate that

choices.answer: The Ottoman Empire never used African slaves
Europeans were invading Africa to capture slaves
Brazil & the Caribbean were major African slave destinations
East Africa was the main source for slaves to the Americas

questions.question: So, labor was needed on plantations, much of it forced. Which type of coerced labor had been used by the Inca Empire?

choices.answer: Chattel Slavery
Indentured Servitude
Encomienda System
Mit'a

questions.question: If you wanted to add arrows on the map to show "Triangular Trade", they'd show

choices.answer: European goods to Africa & Americas crops to Europe
Americas goods to Africa & African slaves to Europe
European cash crops to Americas & African goods to Europe
African cash crops to Europe & Americas silver to Asia.

questions.question: This image shows 6 years in the nearly 400 year Atlantic slave trade. What was NOT an effect of this trade?

choices.answer: Diseases spread because of the deplorable condition of slave ships.
African crops like okra, yams, & rice were diffused to the Americas.
Fossil fuel burning increased to power steam engines for labor.
The coerced labor of slaves on plantations enriched imperial economies.

questions.question: The SANTERIA religion of CUBA (in the Caribbean) would have been a blend of all of these cultures EXCEPT

choices.answer: Spanish Catholicism
East Asian Buddhism
Native American Animism
African Yoruba Shamanism

questions.question: All of the following are true of the effects of the slave trade IN Africa. Which was a SOCIAL consequence?

choices.answer: The population of Africa stagnated even as Eurasia's rapidly grew.
Some states increased in power because they profited from the trade.
More men were taken as slaves causing imbalances in gender and families.
Missionaries brought Christianity into Western and Central Africa.

questions.question: Which region WAS NOT producing many consumer goods for the world market?

choices.answer: Africa
East Asia
South Asia
The Americas

questions.question: All of the following were parts of Martin Luther's arguments against the Catholic Church EXCEPT

choices.answer: He argued against the sale of indulgences.
He argued the Bible should be translated to local languages.
He argued that doing good works was more important than faith.
He argued that all Catholic customs should be questioned.

questions.question: All of the following are true, but what was a POLITICAL effect of the Reformation?

choices.answer: Peasants admired Luther's message of Christian equality.
Luther's emphasis on reading encouraged literacy.
New Christian churches emerged: Lutherans, Anglicans, etc.
Kings & rulers used the protest to increase their power.

questions.question: Why did the vast majority of Latin America become Catholic after 1492?

choices.answer: Chinese explorer Zheng He had spread it on his voyages there
Merchant traders encouraged it to ease trade
Spanish & Portuguese priests were aided by imperial rule
Martin Luther made a trip there to convert people

questions.question: Below is a scene from the 30 year's war after the Reformation. This war involved fights between

choices.answer: Protestants vs. Catholics
Sunni vs. Shia
Hindus vs. Muslims
Philosophes vs. Absolute Monarchs

questions.question: The 'pilgrims' started a wave of British settler colonies in the Americas. What were they looking for?

choices.answer: They were looking for a passage to Asia.
The were looking for gold.
They were Protestants looking to flee religious violence.
They were looking to spread Catholicism.

questions.question: These two images provide evidence that after the Spanish conquest of Mesoamerica...

choices.answer: Mayans remained totally isolated from Spanish conquest.
Mayans preserved & blended their culture into Christianity.
Spanish settlers were able to totally convert all Mayans.
The Mayan religion was identical to European Christianity.

questions.question: This cross from mid-16th century central Mexico would have been carved in the context of

choices.answer: The development of early Aztec culture and mythology.
Aztec empire building through an alliance of the "3 tribes."
Aztecs trying to preserve culture despite Spanish conquest.
Edicts by the Pope which attempted to ban local religions.

questions.question: Our Lady of Guadalupe (1746) MOSTLY reflects a syncretic blending of

choices.answer: Christianity and Islam
Catholic Christianity and Native American culture
Protestant and Catholic Christianity
Native American and African cultures

questions.question: This image of Lisbon, Portugal in the 17th Century could be used by a historian to prove...

choices.answer: empires used monumental architecture to reinforce their rule
navigation & innovations in ship designs were critical to maritime empires
just like land-based empires, maritime empires used guns & cannons
maritime empires created a new economic elite who'd made $ from trade

questions.question: This IVORY statue from 17th century INDIA exported to PORTUGAL could be used as evidence to prove

choices.answer: Ivory=proof that Swahili merchants continued to trade African luxury goods.
India=proof that Asian trade goods were highly in demand.
Crown=proof that imperial states used art to reinforce their legitimacy.
Christ child=proof that Portuguese trading diffused Catholicism to Asia.

questions.question: Throughout the Americas, policies of the European empires were resisted by maroon societies. What were these?

choices.answer: Native Americans resisting land confiscation.
Merchants resisting state tariffs (taxes) on trade.
Protestants & Catholics resisting religious laws.
Africans resisting slavery by running away & fighting for freedom.

questions.question: Below is an image of a follower of "Taki Onqoy". What would he have believed?

choices.answer: It was his duty to convert to Catholicism
It was his duty to convert to Protestantism
It was his duty to fight attempts to convert him

questions.question: The "castas" were

choices.answer: a racially based social hierarchy.
an economic system.
a type of imperial bureaucracy.
a Latin American card game.

questions.question: Which is the correct order of classes in the La Casta system? (from top to bottom)

choices.answer: Creole, Mestizo, Peninsulare, Negro, Indio
Indio, Creole, Peninsulare, Negro, Mestizo
Peninsulare, Creole,Mestizo,Indio, Negro
Peninsulare, Mesitzo,Creole, Negro, Indio

questions.question: All of the following statements are true. Which one could you prove with the CULTURAL evidence from the Casta painting?

choices.answer: Maritime empires used syncretic religions to legitimize their rule.
Eurasian & American foods mixed in the 'Columbian Exchange.'
Local bureaucratic elites were recruited to maintain imperial control.
Taxation, trade, and coerced labor provided revenue for imperial expansion.

questions.question: What is a TRUE social cause of Latin American 'Castas'?

choices.answer: Whole families fled religious violence in Europe to create settler colonies
European men married Native or African women, creating mixed families
The Spanish crown wanted to give equal rights to Natives and Africans.
Women increasingly asserting their desire for suffrage.

questions.question: All of the images below deal MOSTLY with which time period in European history?

choices.answer: The Age of Exploration
The Artistic Renaissance
The Scientific Revolution
The Enlightenment

questions.question: Which breakthrough of the Scientific Revolution most challenged traditional religious views?

choices.answer: The study of the anatomy of the human body
The study of astronomy & the place of the sun in the solar system
The study of mechanics that led to breakthroughs in machinery
The study of mathematics that led to ideas of probability, binomials, & -#s
